moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Bf5 3. h3 h6 4. g4 Be4 5: It's fatal to self-block this square for the knight, but the simple Nf3 was kind of boring. Another try is Rh2. I don't mind castling rights.
moves.6... e6 7. Nd2: Not in a hurry, maybe I should have done e4 right now.
moves.7... Nc6 8. c3: Important, as Nb4 is very annoying.
moves.10... Nge7 11. Ne2: Just waiting to see what will the other do...
moves.11... O-O 12. f4: Let's mix up things before he does...
moves.12... f6: He does. Oh, a lot to calculate, here...
moves.13. f5: But this way, I block his two bishops in one move.
moves.13... exf5 14. exf5 Nb8: Seeing no future for this knight, he plans to redevelop it. But it's a long way, and I have some play.
moves.15. Qb3 b6 16. c4: No mattering the isolani in d and the exposed king, since black is self-trapped.
moves.16... c6 17. O-O: h4 was not a good attack option, it semed to me, so I can castle.
moves.24. Nh5: The queen is trapped. The best: NxBg2, BxQ, NxB.
